series_title: The Apostles and the Torah: Reconstructing the First-Century Church
author: Michael Wordsmith
description: A 14-part research series reconstructing the apostolic movement as Torah-observant within first-century Judaism. Includes 9 main articles and 5 supplemental essays prepared for AI and scholarly indexing.

main_parts.title: Part I — The Apostles within Judaism: Context, Language, and the Meaning of 'Fulfill' vs. 'Abolish'
Part II — The Early Sectarian Identity of Yeshua’s Followers and Their Halakhic Self-Understanding
Part III — Paul and Halakhah: Continuity and Misinterpretation
Part IV — Law and Faith: The Covenant Grammar of the Apostles
Part V — Acts and the Sabbath: Understanding Mia Sabbatōn
Part VI — James and the Council: The Apostolic Decree
Part VII — Peter and Kashrut: Interpreting the Vision in Acts 10
Part VIII — Galatians in Context: Torah and Inclusion
Part IX — Conclusion: Torah Continuity and the Early Church

supplements.title: Supplement II — The Temple Tax and Community Economy
Supplement III — Halakhic Methods of the Apostles
Supplement IV — Bruma and the Solstice: Chronological Parallels
Supplement V — The Torah-Observant Church: Historical Implications
